Specific Details: We contacted TD Niamh Smyth in relation to an issue we had with the HSE, Unfortunately in May E-coli was detected in the building and all staff and children needed to be tested hence the premises was closed down until 2 negative results were received. Parents were told on the day they collected sample bottles that they would be contacted within days with the results. most parents found that they received no correspondence & had to ring on numerous times to try & get results for their children
Subject Matter: We contacted TD Niamh Smyth in relation to an issue we had with the HSE, Unfortunately in May E-coli was detected in the building and all staff and children needed to be tested hence the premises was closed down until 2 negative results were received. Parents were told on the day they collected sample bottles that they would be contacted within days with the results. most parents found that they received no correspondence & had to ring on numerous times to try & get results for their children
Intended Results: Niamh Smyth contacted the hse on the creche's behalf and has asked the minister of health to try and get answers in relation to finding out why there was such a delay in results, the E-coli has told untold damage and then the extra stress of the delay and having parents experiencing serious stress in relation to this. we are hoping the minister comes back with an answer as well as test results for those still waiting.
Lobbying Activities: Niamh Smyth contacted the HSE on numerous times and then sent letters to the minister for health on our behalf|Phone call|2-5

Lobbyist Name: Association of Visitor Experiences and Attractions CLG
Specific Details: Joint Committee on Tourism, Culture, Arts, Sport and Media - Developing Rural Tourism in Ireland
DPOs Lobbied: Niamh Smyth|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Catherine Martin|Minister|Department of Tourism, Culture, Arts, Gaeltacht, Sport and Media
Subject Matter: Joint Committee on Tourism, Culture, Arts, Sport and Media - Developing Rural Tourism in Ireland
Intended Results:
Further to the launch of the JOC Report 'Developing Rural Tourism in Ireland', AVEA recommended the establishment of an inter-departmental Tourism Coordination Committee.
As tourism is a sector dependent on close collaboration of many Departments – Tourism, Transport, Planning, Rural Affairs, Enterprise, Justice, etc – a Committee comprising representatives from all relevant Departments should be established to ensure the recommendations of the Report are implemented in a timely manner.

Specific Details: Public Service Broadcasting
DPOs Lobbied: Catherine Martin|Minister|Department of Tourism, Culture, Arts, Gaeltacht, Sport and Media::Niamh Smyth|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Tríona Quill|Assistant Secretary|Department of Tourism, Culture, Arts, Gaeltacht, Sport and Media
Subject Matter: Public Service Broadcasting
Intended Results: To provide viewpoints in relation to matters associated with public service broadcasting following also from our submissions to the Future of Media Commission in 2021, the subsequent recommendations of the Commission, developments in the sector, public discourse on the manner of funding for public service broadcasting into the future, including that all public service media should benefit from licence fees and/or exchequer funding on a transparent and accountable basis
Lobbying Activities: 1 Letter to Minister Catherine Martin followed by online meeting. Meeting with Niamh Smyth TD and meeting with Triona Quill Assistant Secretary.|Meeting|2-5
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: Áine Ní Chaoindealbháin, Managing Director, Virgin Media Television, Peter McCarthy, Vice President Legal & Corporate Affairs

Specific Details: Sought funding for Vision Tech project. This initiative has made a significant impact, helping over 60 individuals with sight loss to access various assistive technologies—from iPhones to Braille Displays—enabling them to pursue education, employment, and lead more independent lives.
